From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin tolerāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central) [tu.ləˈɾa]
  • IPA(key): (Balearic) [to.ləˈɾa]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [to.leˈɾaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)
  • Rhymes: -a(ɾ)
  • Hyphenation: to‧le‧rar
  • Homophone: tolerà (except Valencian)

Verb

[edit]

tolerar (first-person singular present tolero, first-person singular preterite tolerí, past participle tolerat); root stress: (Central, Valencia, Balearic) /e/

  1. to tolerate

Conjugation

[edit]

gerund tolerant

singular tolerat tolerada
plural tolerats tolerades

imperfect tolerava toleraves tolerava toleràvem toleràveu toleraven

preterite tolerí tolerares tolerà toleràrem toleràreu toleraren
conditional toleraria toleraries toleraria toleraríem toleraríeu tolerarien

vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present toleri toleris toleri tolerem tolereu tolerin
imperfect tolerés toleressis tolerés toleréssim toleréssiu toleressin

vós 		vostès
affirmative — tolera toleri tolerem tolereu tolerin
negative (no) — no toleris no toleri no tolerem no tolereu no tolerin

Related terms

[edit]
  • tolerable
  • tolerància
  • tolerant

Further reading

[edit]
  • “tolerar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007

Galician

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /tolɛˈɾaɾ/ [t̪o.lɛˈɾaɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Hyphenation: to‧le‧rar

Verb

[edit]

tolerar (first-person singular present tolero, first-person singular preterite tolerei, past participle tolerado)

  1. This term needs a translation to English. Please help out and add a translation, then remove the text {{rfdef}}.

Related terms

[edit]
  • tolerancia
  • tolerante

Further reading

[edit]
  • “tolerar”, in Dicionario da Real Academia Galega (in Galician), A Coruña: Royal Galician Academy, 2012–2025
  • “tolerar”, in Dicionário Estraviz de galego (in Galician), 2014–2025

Ido

[edit]

Verb

[edit]

tolerar (present tense toleras, past tense toleris, future tense toleros, imperative tolerez, conditional tolerus)

  1. to tolerate
  2. to endure

Conjugation

[edit]
Conjugation of tolerar
present past future
infinitive tolerar tolerir toleror
tense toleras toleris toleros
conditional tolerus — —
imperative tolerez — —
adjective active participle toleranta tolerinta toleronta
adverbial active participle tolerante tolerinte toleronte
nominal
active participle 		singular toleranto tolerinto toleronto
plural toleranti tolerinti toleronti
adjective passive participle tolerata tolerita tolerota
adverbial passive participle tolerate tolerite tolerote
nominal
passive participle 		singular tolerato tolerito toleroto
plural tolerati toleriti toleroti

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Learned borrowing from Latin tolerāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /to.leˈɾa(ʁ)/ [to.leˈɾa(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /to.leˈɾa(ʁ)/ [to.leˈɾa(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /to.leˈɾa(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /to.leˈɾa(ʁ)/ [to.leˈɾa(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /to.leˈɾa(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /tu.lɨˈɾaɾ/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /tu.lɨˈɾaɾ/
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /tu.lɨˈɾa.ɾi/

  • Hyphenation: to‧le‧rar

Verb

[edit]

tolerar (first-person singular present tolero, first-person singular preterite tolerei, past participle tolerado)

  1. to tolerate, endure, cope

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of tolerar (See Appendix:Portuguese verbs)

(tu) 		Third-person

Personal tolerar tolerares tolerar tolerarmos tolerardes tolerarem

tolerando
Past participle

Feminine tolerada toleradas

Imperfect tolerava toleravas tolerava tolerávamos toleráveis toleravam
Preterite tolerei toleraste tolerou toleramos1, tolerámos2 tolerastes toleraram

1Brazilian Portuguese.
2European Portuguese.

Related terms

[edit]
  • tolerância
  • tolerante
  • tolerável

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin tolerāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /toleˈɾaɾ/ [t̪o.leˈɾaɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: to‧le‧rar

Verb

[edit]

tolerar (first-person singular present tolero, first-person singular preterite toleré, past participle tolerado)

  1. to tolerate
  2. to endure
  3. to condone

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of tolerar (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)
infinitive tolerar
gerund tolerando
past participle masculine feminine
singular tolerado tolerada
plural tolerados toleradas
singular plural

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
